TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit KerberosSecurityTokenProvider extends System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider

Docs.summary: Represents a security token provider that provides security tokens for a SOAP message sender.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In most instances the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider> class doesn't need to be called directly, as it is called when a client sends a SOAP message that requires a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token. Specifically, a client specifies the type of security token needed using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method to get a security token. When the security token needed is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%28System.TimeSpan%29> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string servicePrincipalName) cil managed

Docs.param: The service principal name to get a security token for.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified service principal name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor sets the impersonation level that is allowed by a client to <xref:System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel>`Identification`. The current context of the calling thread (<xref:System.Net.CredentialCache.DefaultNetworkCredentials%2A>) is used as a client identity.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string servicePrincipalName, valuetype System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel tokenImpersonationLevel) cil managed

Docs.param: The service principal name to get a security token for.
A that specifies the degree to which a recipient of the security token can act on behalf of the client.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified service principal name and whether a client allows a recipient of the security token to impersonate the client's credentials.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The current context of the calling thread (<xref:System.Net.CredentialCache.DefaultNetworkCredentials%2A>) is used as a client identity.

MemberSignature.Value: public KerberosSecurityTokenProvider (string servicePrincipalName, System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel tokenImpersonationLevel, System.Net.NetworkCredential credential);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string servicePrincipalName, valuetype System.Security.Principal.TokenImpersonationLevel tokenImpersonationLevel, class System.Net.NetworkCredential credential) cil managed

Docs.param: The service principal name to get a security token for.
A that specifies the degree to which a recipient of the security token can act on behalf of the client process.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified service principal name, client identity, and whether a client allows a recipient of the security token to impersonate the client's credentials.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken GetTokenCore(valuetype System.TimeSpan timeout) cil managed

Docs.param: A that specifies the timeout value for the message that gets the security token.
Docs.returns: The that represents the security token to get.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method is called by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ClientCredentials> class when a client sends a SOAP message and a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken> security token is needed.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider.GetToken%2A> method calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets the identity of the security token.
Docs.value: A that represents the identity of the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the value of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.NetworkCredential%2A> property is `null` and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.GetTokenCore%2A> method is called, the current context of the calling thread (<xref:System.Net.CredentialCache.DefaultNetworkCredentials%2A>) is used as a client identity.

Docs.summary: Gets the service principal name of the security token to get.
Docs.value: The service principal name of the security token to get.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies the degree to which a recipient of the security token can act on behalf of the client.
Docs.value: A that specifies the degree to which a recipient of the security token can act on behalf of the client.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.KerberosSecurityTokenProvider.TokenImpersonationLevel%2A> property must be either `Identification` or `Impersonation`.
